content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
NEUTRAL regime — normal volatility at 26.0% with very narrow participation: breadth 1/8 sectors positive, signaling concentrated leadership but limited market-wide follow-through.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Banking & Finance is leading and ABOVE TREND: Banking (1W: +0.05% | 1M: +10.17%) with AKBNK and YKBNK driving gains.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Transportation is the clearest laggard and BELOW TREND: Transportation (1W: -10.82% | 1M: -0.46%); most other sectors are in CORRECTION (1W negative, 1M positive).

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
TRALT (1W: +13.07% | 1M: +13.17%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +12.32% | 1M: +14.86%) ABOVE TREND, EREGL (1W: +9.90% | 1M: +15.87%) ABOVE TREND, ASELS (1W: +5.10% | 1M: -4.41%) RECOVERY, YKBNK (1W: +3.21% | 1M: +12.56%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
ARCLK (1W: -8.26% | 1M: +5.68%) CORRECTION, HEKTS (1W: -8.65% | 1M: -1.25%) BELOW TREND, TKFEN (1W: -8.84% | 1M: +10.59%) CORRECTION, TSKB (1W: -8.94% | 1M: -2.56%) BELOW TREND, SASA (1W: -9.09% | 1M: -4.00%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Highest momentum names: TRALT (1W: +13.07% | 1M: +13.17%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +12.32% | 1M: +14.86%) ABOVE TREND, EREGL (1W: +9.90% | 1M: +15.87%) ABOVE TREND, TAVHL (1W: -11.42% | 1M: -3.76%) BELOW TREND, KONTR (1W: -11.01% | 1M: +2.82%) CORRECTION.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banking shows leadership but narrow scope: AKBNK (1W: +2.98% | 1M: +14.94%) ABOVE TREND, YKBNK (1W: +3.21% | 1M: +12.56%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: +0.13% | 1M: +5.77%) ABOVE TREND, TSKB (1W: -8.94% | 1M: -2.56%) BELOW TREND — prefer large-cap retail banks and avoid outliers.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry mixed with clear winners and losers: EREGL (1W: +9.90% | 1M: +15.87%) ABOVE TREND, KRDMD (1W: +2.33% | 1M: +9.86%) ABOVE TREND, ASELS (1W: +5.10% | 1M: -4.41%) RECOVERY, VESTL (1W: -9.79% | 1M: -3.55%) BELOW TREND, ARCLK (1W: -8.26% | 1M: +5.68%) CORRECTION.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy shows dispersion: TRALT (1W: +13.07% | 1M: +13.17%) ABOVE TREND and TRMET (1W: +12.32% | 1M: +14.86%) ABOVE TREND are leadership names, while SASA (1W: -9.09% | 1M: -4.00%) BELOW TREND and HEKTS (1W: -8.65% | 1M: -1.25%) BELOW TREND are under pressure; TUPRS (1W: +0.91% | 1M: -2.20%) is RECOVERY.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Remain selective: overweight high-conviction banking names (AKBNK, YKBNK) and standout industrial/energy leaders (EREGL, TRALT, TRMET, ENKAI) while underweight Transportation, weak tech/retail laggards and single-stock names showing BELOW TREND; keep cash/hedges for breadth-driven reversals.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
TRALT (1W: +13.07% | 1M: +13.17%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +12.32% | 1M: +14.86%) ABOVE TREND, EREGL (1W: +9.90% | 1M: +15.87%) ABOVE TREND, TAVHL (1W: -11.42% | 1M: -3.76%) BELOW TREND, AKBNK (1W: +2.98% | 1M: +14.94%) ABOVE TREND.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Banking & Finance for leadership sustainability; Heavy Industry and Energy for continued idiosyncratic rallies versus Transportation for risk of further underperformance.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100 reaction to macro/cash flow catalysts (CBRT communication, FX moves, global risk sentiment) and technical pivots around the 20-day/50-day ranges for trend confirmation; intra-sector earnings, oil and commodity moves and regional geopolitical headlines will be immediate triggers.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Neutral volatility with extremely narrow breadth — leadership concentrated in banks and a handful of energy/industrial stocks while most sectors sit in CORRECTION or BELOW TREND. Trade selectively: own leaders with size discipline and hedge exposure to Transportation and weak Tech names.
